intro: Rourea erecta, commonly known as the upright rourea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Rourea erecta is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
